metadata.Title: CVE-2020-4788 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
IBM Power9 (AIX 7.1, 7.2, and VIOS 3.1) processors could allow a local user to obtain sensitive information from the data in the L1 cache under extenuating circumstances. IBM X-Force ID: 189296. It was discovered that Power 9 processors could be coerced to expose information from the L1 cache in certain situations. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-4788` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-197-generic - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-lowlatency - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-197-generic - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-197-lowlatency - 4.4.0-197.229
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1119-aws - 4.4.0-1119.133
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-126-generic - 4.15.0-126.129~16.04.1

notes.Note: sbeattie> Power9 support landed in ~4.9 timeframe

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-197.229').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1119.133').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-126.129~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1085.94').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1143.153').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-197.229').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-126.129~16.04.1').
linux-signed-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1147.157').
